item.title: Dani add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dani add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Dani add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Dani add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dani add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I am selfish, private and easily bored. Will this be a problem?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Dani add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Someone has said that it requires less mental effort to condemn than to think." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Dani add a quote by Lucille Ball
item.description: "I'd rather regret the things I have done than the things that I haven't." -- Lucille Ball

item.title: Dani add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Dani add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Dani add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "We all die. The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Dani add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "In a world where billions believe their deity conceived a mortal child with a virgin human, it's stunning how little imagination most people display." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Dani add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The scariest moment is always just before you start." -- Stephen King

item.title: Dani add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Dani add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is no sin except stupidity." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dani add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I have observed, indeed, generally, that while in protestant countries the defections from the Platonic Christianity of the priests is to Deism, in catholic countries they are to Atheism. [author:Diderot|11004], [author:D'Alembert|3295333], [author:Dâ€™Holbach|1228712], [author:Condorcet|6420223], are known to have been among the most virtuous of men. Their virtue, then, must have had some other foundation than the love of God.
[<i>Letter to Thomas Law, 13 June 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Dani add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "There must be quite a few things that a hot bath won't cure, but I don't know many of them." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Dani add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I sincerely believe that banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies, and that the principle of spending money to be paid by posterity, under the name of funding, is but swindling futurity on a large scale." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Dani add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Dani add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself-and especially to feel, or not feel. Whatever you happen to be feeling at any moment is fine with them. That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Dani add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Dani add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dani add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Scratch any cynic and you will find a disappointed idealist." -- George Carlin

item.title: Dani add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Dani add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Dani add a quote by Bertold Brecht
item.description: "Because things are the way they are, things will not stay the way they are." -- Bertold Brecht

item.title: Dani add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "The human race tends to remember the abuses to which it has been subjected rather than the endearments. What's left of kisses? Wounds, however, leave scars." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Dani add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The most violent element in society is ignorance. " -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Dani add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "You are -- your life, and nothing else." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Dani add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Dani add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling
